mdRecord.dcterms:title: Pohick Church, interior|detail view

Wren, James (1728-1815) (American builder) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Attributed to James Wren. George Washington and George Mason may have influenced the design. Altered 1840, 1874; restored 1901-1916. Interior woodwork by William Bernard Sears destroyed in the Civil War. Existing woodwork dates from 1901-1916, Glenn Brown, designer. -- Virginia Landmarks Register, 1999. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
